publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1781# Elaine Smith: Mental Health and Young People—That the Parliament welcomes the £8.6 million allocated from the Mental Health and Well Being Development Fund since its inception in September 1997, in particular the £2 million funding for the nine new mental health projects throughout Scotland announced by the Deputy Minister for Health and Community Care on 20 March 2001; notes the publication by the National Schizophrenia Fellowship of the report Tomorrow’s Minds, which shows that the majority of teenagers and young adults believe that they would face discrimination if they developed a mental health problem, and, in the light of this report, believes that the Scottish Executive should give consideration to running an education campaign, aimed at young people, to combat negative attitudes towards mental illness.

S1M-1781# Elaine Smith: Mental Health and Young People—That the Parliament welcomes the £8.6 million allocated from the Mental Health and Well Being Development Fund since its inception in September 1997, in particular the £2 million funding for the nine new mental health projects throughout Scotland announced by the Deputy Minister for Health and Community Care on 20 March 2001; notes the publication by the National Schizophrenia Fellowship of the report Tomorrow’s Minds, which shows that the majority of teenagers and young adults believe that they would face discrimination if they developed a mental health problem, and, in the light of this report, believes that the Scottish Executive should give consideration to running an education campaign, aimed at young people, to combat negative attitudes towards mental illness.
S1M-1781# Mental Health and Young People (lodged on 22 March 2001) Tommy Sheridan*, Rhoda Grant*
S1M-1781# Mental Health and Young People (lodged on 22 March 2001) Irene Oldfather*, Fiona Hyslop*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Johann Lamont*
S1M-1781# Mental Health and Young People (lodged on 22 March 2001) Donald Gorrie*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Scott Barrie*, Trish Godman*
S1M-1781# Mental Health and Young People (lodged on 22 March 2001) Maureen Macmillan*

S1M-1781# Elaine Smith: Mental Health and Young People—That the Parliament welcomes the £8.6 million allocated from the Mental Health and Well Being Development Fund since its inception in September 1997, in particular the £2 million funding for the nine new mental health projects throughout Scotland announced by the Deputy Minister for Health and Community Care on 20 March 2001; notes the publication by the National Schizophrenia Fellowship of the report Tomorrow’s Minds, which shows that the majority of teenagers and young adults believe that they would face discrimination if they developed a mental health problem, and, in the light of this report, believes that the Scottish Executive should give consideration to running an education campaign, aimed at young people, to combat negative attitudes towards mental illness. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Rhoda Grant, Irene Oldfather, Fiona Hyslop, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Johann Lamont, Donald Gorrie, Mr Adam Ingram, Dr Elaine Murray, Scott Barrie, Trish Godman, Maureen Macmillan
S1M-1781# Mental Health and Young People (lodged on 22 March 2001) Mr Michael McMahon*
S1M-1781# Mental Health and Young People (lodged on 22 March 2001) Dr Sylvia Jackson*
S1M-1781# Mental Health and Young People (lodged on 22 March 2001) Karen Whitefield*, Cathy Jamieson*
S1M-1781# Mental Health and Young People (lodged on 22 March 2001) Margaret Jamieson*, Fiona McLeod*
S1M-1781# Mental Health and Young People (lodged on 22 March 2001) Ms Margo MacDonald*, Colin Campbell*
